bibl.title: In Re: Petition of H. C. Littooy for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District Of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol2.

div1.p: United States of America District of Washington

H. C. Littooy being first duly sworn on oath, says: That he is the Petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has heard the foregoing Petition read, knows the contents thereof, and believes teh same to be true; that he make this affidavit because
H. C. Littooy Subscribed and swears to before me this 11th day of June A.D. 1904
John R. Parker Rotary Public in and for the State of washington, residing at Seattle
In the United States Circuit Court FOR THE DISTRICT OF Washington Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of H.C. Littooy for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
